title.narrative: 1.1 SCALE UP NUTRITION SERVICES

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development Programme Component Results (PCR) 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)

Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

description.narrative: New analysis of National Family Health Survey (NFHS) 4 data shows that maternal malnutrition is a major cause of infant malnutrition. Steps made towards addressing maternal malnutrition includes strengthening evidence on what works, developing and rolling out new programme guidance and inclusion in new State and National Nutrition Missions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: Proportion of states with a broad-based partnership for scaling up essential nutrition services for children undertwo and their mothers is functional ( Broad-based means that it is inclusive but not limited to public sector, academic institutions, professional bodies, private sector, development partners, media, alliances and champions, Functional means that it has contributed to the achievement of positive advocacy, policy and/or programme outcomes and that this contribution is documented)
Proportion of states with a broad-based partnership for scaling up essential nutrition services for children under two and their mothers
Proportion of states with a comprehensive programme implementation plan and budgets to scale up services to control micronutrient deficiencies and anemia in children and mothers

Proportion of states with a comprehensive (Comprehensive means that it prioritizes the delivery of all evidence-based, essential nutrition interventions through a mix of facility-, outreach- and community-based approaches, with a commensurate budget) programme implementation plan and budgets to scale up services to protect, promote and support optimal infant and young child feeding practices and related maternal nutrition
